item.title: Report E-2024090475
item.description:
Report E-2024090475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090936
item.description:
Report X-2024090936

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO A LABEL ON THE BOX STATING, "BATTERY INSIDE". UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR LENOVO THINKPADS. TWO OF THE THINKPADS WERE PACKAGED INSIDE LAPTOP BAGS. TWO OF THE THINKPADS WERE PACKED INSIDE THE BOX IN USPS PAD PACKS. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED TWO LAPTOP CHARGERS AND A LENOVO LAPTOP DOCK. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024090341
item.description:
Report E-2024090341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2135 ET XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLU. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Master Pro Refinishing 5700 was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3157295. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The terminal used a 55-gallon drum for waste, which was staged on site for personnel to manage.
